title: Bad Bunny - DtMf (DeBÍ TiRAR MáS FOToS)
titleTranslation: Bad Bunny - I Should Have Taken More Photos

thumbnail.generation_prompt: Bad Bunny style, San Juan Puerto Rico sunset, nostalgic summer vibe, palm trees, ocean, warm colors, reggaeton mood.

tags.name: Grammar
tags.description: Gerunds, past tense, colloquial tú, Caribbean Spanish

tags.name: Vocabulary
tags.description: Slang, Puerto Rican Spanish, shortened forms, music and feelings

tags.name: Themes
tags.description: Nostalgia, regret, missing someone, photos and memories, Puerto Rico

content.text: Otro sunset bonito que veo en San Juan
content.translation: Another beautiful sunset I see in San Juan
detailedTranslation: sunset — English loan word, same meaning (beautiful sunset)
San Juan — capital of Puerto Rico

content.text: Disfrutando de todas esas cosas que extrañan los que se van
content.translation: Enjoying all those things that those who leave miss
detailedTranslation: Disfrutando — enjoying; gerund of disfrutar
extrañan — they miss; infinitive extrañar (los que se van = those who leave)

content.text: Disfrutando de noche' de esas que ya no se dan
content.translation: Enjoying nights like those that don't happen anymore
detailedTranslation: noche' — shortened for noches (dropped 's' at end, common in Caribbean/colloquial speech)
se dan — they happen; darse = to occur, to happen

content.text: Que ya no se dan
content.translation: That don't happen anymore
detailedTranslation: ya no se dan — they don't happen anymore; repetition for emphasis

content.text: Pero queriendo volver a la última vez
content.translation: But wanting to go back to the last time
detailedTranslation: queriendo — wanting; gerund of querer
volver a — to go back to

content.text: Que a los ojos te miré
content.translation: When I looked at you in the eyes
detailedTranslation: te miré — I looked at you; infinitive mirar, pretérito
a los ojos — in(to) the eyes (looking someone in the eyes)

content.text: Y contarte las cosas que no te conté (Te parece' a mi crush, jaja)
content.translation: And tell you the things I didn't tell you (You look like my crush, haha)
detailedTranslation: contarte — to tell you; infinitive contar + te
conté — I told; contar, pretérito
Te parece' — you look like; parecer (shortened: pareces → parece')
crush — English loan; person you have a crush on
jaja — haha (Spanish onomatopoeia for laughing)

content.text: Y tirarte la' foto' que no te tiré (Acho, jura'o te ves bien linda, déjame tirarte una foto)
content.translation: And take the photos of you that I didn't take (Hey man, I swear you look really pretty, let me take a photo of you)
detailedTranslation: tirarte la' foto' — to take (you) the photos; tirar fotos = to take photos (Caribbean/colloquial)
la' — shortened for las (dropped 's')
foto' — shortened for fotos
tiré — I took; tirar, pretérito
Acho — Puerto Rican slang: dude, man, hey (friendly)
jura'o — shortened for jurao/jurado = I swear (jura'o = jurado, colloquial)
tirarte una foto — to take a photo of you

content.text: Ey, tengo el pecho pela'o, me dio una matá'
content.translation: Hey, I have my chest bare / my heart broken, it gave me a heart attack
detailedTranslation: pecho pela'o — bare chest; pela'o = pelado (shortened, -ado → -a'o in Caribbean slang)
matá' — shortened for matada; here = like a 'kill' / heart attack, slang for strong emotion or pain

content.text: El corazón dándome patá'
content.translation: My heart giving me kicks / pounding
detailedTranslation: patá' — shortened for patadas (kicks); darme patadas = to pound (heart), to give me kicks

content.text: Dime, baby, ¿dónde tú está'?
content.translation: Tell me, baby, where are you?
detailedTranslation: baby — English, term of endearment
tú está' — you are; está' = estás (dropped 's')
¿dónde tú está'? — Caribbean word order: where you at? (standard: ¿dónde estás tú?)

content.text: Pa' llegarle con RoRo, Julito, Krystal
content.translation: To get to you with RoRo, Julito, Krystal (friends' names)
detailedTranslation: Pa' — shortened for Para (to, in order to)
llegarle — to get to you; llegar + le (Caribbean 'you')
RoRo, Julito, Krystal — names of people / crew

content.text: Roig, Edgar, Seba, Óscar, Darnell y Big Jay, tocando batá
content.translation: Roig, Edgar, Seba, Óscar, Darnell and Big Jay, playing batá
detailedTranslation: tocando — playing; gerund of tocar
batá — Afro-Caribbean drums (batá drums), used in Puerto Rican music

content.text: Hoy la calle la dejamo' 'esbaratá
content.translation: Today we left the street destroyed / lit
detailedTranslation: dejamo' — we left; shortened for dejamos
'esbaratá — shortened for esbaratada (destroyed, messed up; here = we tore it up / had a great time)

content.text: Y sería cabrón que tú me toque' el güiro
content.translation: And it would be crazy / messed up if you play the güiro on me
detailedTranslation: cabrón — literally 'big goat'; slang: badass, crazy, intense (depends on context)
toque' — you play; shortened for toques (subjunctive of tocar)
güiro — percussion instrument (gourd), typical in Puerto Rican and Caribbean music)

content.text: Yo veo tu nombre y me salen suspiro'
content.translation: I see your name and I let out sighs
detailedTranslation: suspiro' — shortened for suspiros (sighs)
me salen — they come out (of me); salir

content.text: No sé si son petardo' o si son tiro'
content.translation: I don't know if they're firecrackers or if they're shots
detailedTranslation: petardo' — shortened for petardos (firecrackers; or slang for something lame)
tiro' — shortened for tiros (shots, gunshots; or 'hits' like hits of emotion)

content.text: Mi blanquita, perico, mi kilo
content.translation: My white girl / my light one, perico, my kilo
detailedTranslation: blanquita — affectionate: my light-skinned one, my girl (diminutive of blanca)
perico — literally parakeet; slang: cocaine (here could be term of endearment or drug reference depending on interpretation)
kilo — kilo; can be drug slang or just 'my weight' / my person

content.text: Yo estoy en PR, tranquilo, pero
content.translation: I'm in PR, chillin', but
detailedTranslation: PR — Puerto Rico (abbreviation)
tranquilo — calm, chillin'; here: I'm good / relaxed

content.text: Debí tirar más fotos de cuando te tuve
content.translation: I should have taken more photos of when I had you
detailedTranslation: Debí — I should have; deber, pretérito
te tuve — I had you; tener, pretérito

content.text: Debí darte más beso' y abrazo' las vece' que pude
content.translation: I should have given you more kisses and hugs the times I could
detailedTranslation: beso' — kisses (besos); shortened
abrazo' — hugs (abrazos); shortened
vece' — times (veces); shortened
pude — I could; poder, pretérito

content.text: Ey, ojalá que los mío' nunca se muden
content.translation: Hey, I hope mine never move away
detailedTranslation: ojalá que — I hope that (subjunctive)
mío' — mine, my people (míos); shortened
se muden — they move (away); mudarse, subjunctive

content.text: Y si hoy me emborracho, pues que me ayuden
content.translation: And if I get drunk today, well may they help me
detailedTranslation: me emborracho — I get drunk; emborracharse
que me ayuden — (may they) help me; subjunctive

content.text: Debí tirar más foto' de cuando te tuve
content.translation: I should have taken more photos of when I had you
detailedTranslation: foto' — photos (fotos); shortened

content.text: Debí darte más beso' y abrazo' las veces que pude
content.translation: I should have given you more kisses and hugs the times I could

content.text: Ojalá que los mío' nunca se muden
content.translation: I hope mine never move away

content.text: Y si hoy me emborracho, pues que me ayuden
content.translation: And if I get drunk today, well may they help me

content.text: Ey, hoy voy a estar con abuelo to'l día, jugando dominó
content.translation: Hey, today I'm gonna be with grandpa all day, playing dominoes
detailedTranslation: to'l — todo el (all the); shortened
dominó — dominoes (game)

content.text: Si me pregunta si aún pienso en ti, yo le digo que no
content.translation: If he asks me if I still think about you, I tell him no

content.text: Que mi estadía cerquita de ti ya se terminó
content.translation: That my stay close to you is already over
detailedTranslation: estadía — stay, time spent
cerquita — nice and close; diminutive of cerca

content.text: Ya se terminó, ey
content.translation: It's already over, hey

content.text: Que prendan la' máquina', voy pa' Santurce
content.translation: Let them start up the machines, I'm going to Santurce
detailedTranslation: la' máquina' — the machines (las máquinas); shortened
pa' — to (para); voy pa' = I'm going to
Santurce — neighborhood in San Juan, PR

content.text: Aquí todavía se da caña
content.translation: Here they still give it (party) hard / rum flows
detailedTranslation: se da caña — they give caña; dar caña = to party hard, go hard; caña = rum or intensity

content.text: Chequéate las babie', diablo, mami, qué dulce
content.translation: Check out the babies / the crew, damn, mami, so sweet
detailedTranslation: Chequéate — check yourself / check it out; chequear(se)
babie' — babies (English loan, shortened); slang for girls/crew
diablo — devil; here interjection like 'damn'
mami — mommy; term of endearment for a woman

content.text: Hoy yo quiero beber, beber, beber
content.translation: Today I want to drink, drink, drink

content.text: Y hablar mierda hasta que me expulsen
content.translation: And talk shit until they kick me out
detailedTranslation: hablar mierda — to talk shit (vulgar)
expulsen — they kick (me) out; expulsar, subjunctive

content.text: 'Toy bien loco ('Toy bien loco), 'toy bien loco ('Toy bien loco)
content.translation: I'm so crazy (I'm so crazy), I'm so crazy (I'm so crazy)
detailedTranslation: 'Toy — I'm (Estoy); shortened, very common in Caribbean/slang

content.text: Cabrón, guía tú, que hasta caminando yo estoy que choco
content.translation: Damn, you drive / lead, 'cause even walking I'm about to crash
detailedTranslation: guía tú — you drive / you lead; guiar
estoy que choco — I'm about to crash; estar que + verb = on the verge of

content.text: 'Toy bien loco ('Toy bien loco), 'toy bien loco ('Toy bien loco)
content.translation: I'm so crazy (I'm so crazy), I'm so crazy (I'm so crazy)

content.text: Vamo' a disfrutar, que nunca se sabe si nos queda poco
content.translation: Let's enjoy, 'cause you never know if we have little left
detailedTranslation: Vamo' — let's (vamos); shortened

content.text: Debí tirar más f—
content.translation: I should have taken more pho—
detailedTranslation: Lyric cuts off (fotos); artistic effect

content.text: Gente, lo' quiero con cojone', los amo
content.translation: Guys, I love you with (all my) guts, I love you
detailedTranslation: lo' — them/you (los); shortened
cojone' — guts, balls (cojones); con cojones = with guts, for real

content.text: Gracias por estar aquí, de verdad
content.translation: Thanks for being here, for real

content.text: Para mí e' bien importante que estén aquí
content.translation: For me it's really important that you're here
detailedTranslation: e' — it's (es); shortened

content.text: Cada uno de ustede' significa mucho para mí
content.translation: Each one of you means a lot to me
detailedTranslation: ustede' — you all (ustedes); shortened

content.text: Así que, vamo' pa' la foto, vengan pa'cá
content.translation: So, let's go for the photo, come over here
detailedTranslation: vamo' pa' — let's go for (vamos para)
pa'cá — over here (para acá); shortened

content.text: Métase to'l mundo, to'l corillo, vamo'
content.translation: Everybody get in, the whole crew, let's go
detailedTranslation: to'l — todo el (all the); shortened
corillo — crew, group of friends (Puerto Rican slang)
Métase — get in (formal/plural); meterse

content.text: Zumba
content.translation: Zumba (dance/fitness or exclamation)
detailedTranslation: Zumba — brand name for dance fitness; here could be exclamation or reference

content.text: Ya Bernie tiene el nene y Jan la nena
content.translation: Now Bernie has the boy and Jan the girl
detailedTranslation: nene / nena — baby boy / baby girl; kids

content.text: Ya no estamo' pa' la movie' y las cadena'
content.translation: We're not here for the movies and the chains / TV
detailedTranslation: estamo' — we are (estamos); shortened
movie' — movies (English loan); shortened
cadena' — chains (cadenas); can mean TV networks

content.text: 'Tamos pa' las cosa' que valgan la pena
content.translation: We're here for the things that are worth it
detailedTranslation: 'Tamos — we're (Estamos); shortened
cosa' — things (cosas); shortened
valgan la pena — are worth it; valer la pena, subjunctive

content.text: Ey, pa'l perreo, la salsa, la bomba y la plena
content.translation: Hey, for perreo, salsa, bomba and plena
detailedTranslation: pa'l — for the (para el); shortened
perreo — reggaeton dance (doggy-style dance)
bomba — Puerto Rican music/dance genre
plena — Puerto Rican music genre

content.text: Chequéate la mía cómo es que suena
content.translation: Check out mine how it sounds
detailedTranslation: Chequéate — check it out
la mía — mine (the one that's mine)

content.text: Debí tirar más fotos de cuando te tuve
content.translation: I should have taken more photos of when I had you

content.text: Debí darte más besos y abrazo' las veces que pude
content.translation: I should have given you more kisses and hugs the times I could

content.text: Ojalá que los mío' nunca se muden
content.translation: I hope mine never move away

content.text: Y que tú me envíe' más nude'
content.translation: And that you send me more nudes
detailedTranslation: envíe' — you send (envíes); subjunctive, shortened
nude' — nudes (English loan); shortened

content.text: Y si hoy me emborracho, que Beno me ayude
content.translation: And if I get drunk today, may Beno help me
detailedTranslation: Beno — friend's name (Beno or similar)

sunset.explanation: English loan word; same meaning. Common in Caribbean and urban Spanish.

noche'.explanation: Shortened form: final 's' dropped and written with apostrophe. Very common in Puerto Rican and Caribbean Spanish in song and speech.

la'.explanation: Shortened for 'las'. Same dropping of final 's' as noche', foto', etc.

foto'.explanation: Shortened for 'fotos'. Tirar fotos = to take photos (Caribbean/colloquial).

parece'.explanation: Shortened for 'pareces' (you look like). Te parece' a mi crush = You look like my crush.

crush.explanation: English loan: person you have a romantic crush on.

acho.explanation: Puerto Rican slang. Friendly interjection, like 'hey' or 'man'. Used a lot in casual speech.

jura'o.explanation: Shortened/colloquial for 'jurado'. Jura'o te ves bien = I swear you look good.

pela'o.explanation: Shortened form: -ado → -a'o in Caribbean Spanish. Pecho pela'o = bare chest (or emotionally exposed).

matá'.explanation: Shortened for 'matada'. Here: 'me dio una matá'' = it hit me like a kill / gave me a heart attack (strong emotion).

patá'.explanation: Shortened for 'patadas'. El corazón dándome patá' = my heart giving me kicks (pounding).

baby.explanation: English; term of endearment, same as in English.

está'.explanation: Shortened for 'estás'. ¿Dónde tú está'? = Where are you? (Caribbean word order.)

pa'.explanation: Shortened for 'para'. Very common in speech and lyrics (pa' qué, pa' llegar, etc.).

batá.explanation: Afro-Caribbean drums, used in Puerto Rican and Cuban music. Often in plural: los batá.

dejamo'.explanation: Shortened for 'dejamos'. La calle la dejamo' = we left the street (in a state).

esbaratá.explanation: Shortened for 'esbaratada'. Dejar algo 'esbaratá' = to leave it destroyed / lit (we tore it up).

cabrón.explanation: Slang; literally 'big goat'. Can mean tough, crazy, or (in other contexts) insult. Here: 'sería cabrón' = it would be crazy/intense.

toque'.explanation: Shortened for 'toques' (subjunctive of tocar). Que tú me toque' el güiro = that you play the güiro on me.

güiro.explanation: Percussion instrument (gourd with ridges), typical in Puerto Rican and Caribbean music.

suspiro'.explanation: Shortened for 'suspiros'. Me salen suspiro' = I let out sighs.

petardo'.explanation: Shortened for 'petardos'. Can also be slang for something lame. Here: literal or metaphorical bangs.

tiro'.explanation: Shortened for 'tiros'. Can mean gunshots or emotional 'hits'.

blanquita.explanation: Affectionate; diminutive of blanca. Mi blanquita = my white girl / my light-skinned one (term of endearment).

perico.explanation: Literally parakeet. In slang often means cocaine. In song context can be term of endearment or double meaning.

kilo.explanation: Kilo. In drug slang can mean a kilo of drugs; in affectionate context can mean 'my weight' / my person.

PR.explanation: Abbreviation for Puerto Rico. Yo estoy en PR = I'm in Puerto Rico.

beso'.explanation: Shortened for 'besos'. Same dropped-'s' pattern as foto', noche', etc.

abrazo'.explanation: Shortened for 'abrazos'. Dar abrazos = to give hugs.

vece'.explanation: Shortened for 'veces'. Las vece' que pude = the times I could.

mío'.explanation: Shortened for 'míos'. Los mío' = my people, my family/friends.

to'l.explanation: Shortened for 'todo el'. To'l día = all day, to'l mundo = everybody.

máquina'.explanation: Shortened for 'máquinas'. Prendan la' máquina' = start (up) the machines.

caña.explanation: Literally sugarcane/rum. Dar caña = to go hard, party hard. Se da caña = it goes off.

babie'.explanation: Shortened plural; slang for girls, crew, or 'the babies' (good-looking people).

Toy.explanation: Shortened for 'Estoy'. 'Toy bien loco = I'm so crazy. Very common in Caribbean/slang.

vamo'.explanation: Shortened for 'vamos'. Vamo' a disfrutar = let's enjoy.

lo'.explanation: Shortened for 'los'. Lo' quiero = I love you/them (with cojones = for real).

cojone'.explanation: Shortened for 'cojones'. Con cojone' = with guts, for real. Los quiero con cojone' = I really love you.

e'.explanation: Shortened for 'es'. Para mí e' importante = for me it's important.

ustede'.explanation: Shortened for 'ustedes'. Cada uno de ustede' = each one of you.

pa'cá.explanation: Shortened for 'para acá'. Vengan pa'cá = come over here.

corillo.explanation: Puerto Rican slang. To'l corillo = the whole crew. Group you hang with.

estamo'.explanation: Shortened for 'estamos'. Ya no estamo' pa' = we're not (here) for.

movie'.explanation: Shortened for 'movies'. No estamo' pa' la movie' = we're not here for the movies.

cadena'.explanation: Shortened for 'cadenas'. Can mean chains or TV networks (las cadenas).

Tamos.explanation: Shortened for 'Estamos'. 'Tamos pa' las cosa' = we're here for the things.

cosa'.explanation: Shortened for 'cosas'. Las cosa' que valgan la pena = the things that are worth it.

pa'l.explanation: Shortened for 'para el'. Pa'l perreo = for the perreo.

perreo.explanation: Dance style to reggaeton; from perro (dog). Pa'l perreo = for dancing perreo.

plena.explanation: Puerto Rican music genre. La bomba y la plena = bomba and plena (traditional PR music).

envíe'.explanation: Shortened for 'envíes' (subjunctive of enviar). Que tú me envíe' = that you send me.

nude'.explanation: Shortened for 'nudes'. Envíe' más nude' = send (me) more nudes.
